item.title: VPLS Connects Your Many LANs
item.description: Do you have multiple offices in your company? It’s likely that each office has its own local network for computers and potentially even internet-based phone systems. The question then becomes, how do you link these separate networks together? The solution, unfortunately, is often complex and costly. However, there’s a way to simplify this process and potentially save money compared to your current individual connections: VPLS, or Virtual Private LAN Service. This service is provided by companies like Layer2 Communications and other competitive network providers.
